label: Behavior 56623574
summary: Vessel behavior pattern: navigating along a fixed route (the persistent alignment between COG and heading, combined with stable speed and negligible course deviation, indicates the vessel is following a straight, predefined maritime route; the position progression follows a linear trajectory moving south-southeast, approximated by the parametric equations: lat(t) ≈ 55.1728 - 0.0055 × t, lon(t) ≈ 7.4343 + 0.0019 × t, where t is normalized time index from 0 to 1 over the observed segment)
description: Speed profile: stable (the vessel maintains a nearly constant speed between 13.3 and 13.6 knots, indicating steady propulsion)
Course change: gradual and consistent (COG varies slightly between 173.0° and 175.5°, showing a smooth, slow evolution in direction)
Heading fluctuation: gradual and consistent (heading remains fixed at 174.0° across all records, indicating stable rudder control and no abrupt yawing)

Behavior intent: navigating along a fixed route (the persistent alignment between COG and heading, combined with stable speed and negligible course deviation, indicates the vessel is following a straight, predefined maritime route; the position progression follows a linear trajectory moving south-southeast, approximated by the parametric equations: lat(t) ≈ 55.1728 - 0.0055 × t, lon(t) ≈ 7.4343 + 0.0019 × t, where t is normalized time index from 0 to 1 over the observed segment)
